page.title: 21Wokingham Without: Halls and Activities
page.content:
St. Sebastian's Memorial Hall was built by Howard Palmer and family and is the responsibility of Wokingham Without Parish Council. The rear of the building was originally a Working Men's Club but is now the Howard Palmer Room and is also hired out by Wokingham Without Parish Council.

Both halls are available for hire at very reasonable rates, via the Parish Office. The premises are currently home to a variety of activities, including Women's Institute, diet and exercise, martial arts, art, crafts, dog training, Scottish dancing, theatre school, ballet and Parish Council Meetings. It's also a great venue for private events, from parties and AGM's to wedding receptions and christenings.

St Sebastian's Memorial Hall has two stained glass windows dedicated to those who lost their lives in World War I and II.


Wokingham Without Parish Council
